words.w: We have learnt before that a noun is in the genitive case when it:
i) is preceded by a preposition, e.g.
البَيْتُ: فِي البَيْتِ         بِلاَلٌ: مِنْ بِلاَلٍ
المُدَرِّسُ: كِتَابُ المُدَرِّسِ   بِلاَلٌ: بِنْتُ بِلاَلٍ
Please note that a diptote in these two situations takes a fathah instead of kasrah, i.e. the genitive ending in ordinary nouns is <<-i>>, but in diptotes it is <<-a>>, e.g.
